title: Kerala to pilot first multimodal transport app in the country

The integrated app will be launched on December 16 in Kochi in the first phase.

content: A day after throwing 96 pitches in a Game 6 win, World Series MVP Yoshinobu Yamamoto pitched 2‚Öî scoreless innings in relief to help lead the Dodgers to victory in Game 7 and the championship.

content: Teams have inquired to the Seahawks about the availability of standout linebacker Boye Mafe and former Pro Bowl cornerback Riq Woolen, sources told ESPN.

content: Playing without injured running back Hollywood Smothers, the ACC's rushing leader, NC State stunned No. 8 Georgia Tech 48-36 on Saturday night, ending the Yellow Jackets' unbeaten run, and giving the Wolfpack their first win over a top-10 foe since 2021.

content: Michael Jordan didn't hold back on load management in the NBA, saying on NBC: "It shouldn't be needed, first and foremost."

content: Stories about how the quarterback became one of the quirkiest, toughest and most insatiable players in college football.

content: History says a 30-win season could lead to a national title (see: Florida). Which teams could achieve the feat this season?

content: Just four drivers are left standing in NASCAR's 2025 playoffs, and come Sunday afternoon in Phoenix, one of them will be crowned Cup Series champion.

title: Why is Mike McDaniel still in Miami? Answering key questions about Dolphins' shakeup
content: Answering the key questions following the Dolphins' decision to part ways with Chris Grier and keep Mike McDaniel.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye loan deal for Real Madrid's Endrick
content: Real Madrid's Endrick is a loan target for Premier League rivals Manchester United and Aston Villa. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: JDU's Anant Singh Arrested In Jan Suraaj Supporter's Murder Case
content: Jan Suraaj supporter Dular Chand Yadav was killed while he was campaigning for Jan Suraaj Party's candidate Priyadarshi Piyush in Mokama.

title: ISRO Launches India's 'Heaviest' Communication Satellite From Sriharikota
content: An ISRO heavy-lift rocket with communication satellite CMS-03, the 'heaviest' to be carried by an Indian launch vehicle into the Geosynchronous Transfer Orbit (GTO), lifted off from the spaceport here on Sunday.

title: UP Man Kills Wife With Iron Rod After Dispute, Locks Child, 3, With Body
content: A man allegedly killed his wife with an iron rod following a domestic dispute and fled the scene after locking their three-year-old child in the same room with the victim's body, police said on Sunday.

title: 14-Year-Old Girl Left Home For Tuition, Gang-Raped In Kolkata, 3 Arrested
content: Three men have been arrested and charged with gang-raping a minor girl in Kolkata's Dum Dum area. The 14-year-old student of Class 7 had gone for tuition on Saturday evening when the incident occurred, said police sources.

title: 281 Killed In Political Violence In Bangladesh Since Hasina's Fall: Report
content: Nearly 300 people have been killed in political violence in Bangladesh in the year since student-led protests toppled autocratic former leader Sheikh Hasina, the country's main human rights group said on Sunday.

title: Child's Wish Paramount In Custody Disputes, Rules Uttarakhand High Court
content: The Uttarakhand High Court has held that the wishes and mental well-being of a minor child should be considered paramount when deciding on custody and visitation rights.

title: 2 French Cops Charged With Raping Woman In Custody
content: Two French policemen have been charged with allegedly raping a young woman while she was in custody, with one of the suspects apparently filming the act on his phone.

title: Training For Roll Revision Sees Protests Over Duty Hours, Security In West Bengal
content: Training exercises for Block Level Officers for the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of voter rolls in Kolkata and other districts saw disruptions on Saturday after government employees raised several demands, including a central security cover.

title: Video: 2 Cousins Die As Car Spins Out Of Control, Hits Pune Metro Pillar
content: Two cousins were killed, and one person was seriously injured after their speeding car crashed into a metro station pillar in Pune in the early hours of Sunday.

title: 23 Killed, Including Children In Blast At Mexican Supermarket
content: A supermarket explosion killed at least 23 people in northern Mexico on Saturday, according to local officials, with investigators saying the blast was an accident possibly caused by a faulty electric transformer.

title: Iran Vows to Rebuild Nuclear Sites 'Stronger Than Before' After US Strikes
content: Iran said on Sunday that it would rebuild nuclear sites damaged by Israeli and US strikes "stronger than before", as mediator Oman urged Tehran and Washington to revive stalled diplomacy.

title: Village Hoardings Barring Entry To Converted Christians Precautionary: High Court
content: The Chhattisgarh High Court has disposed of two petitions seeking the removal of hoardings prohibiting entry to pastors and "converted Christians" in eight villages, holding that they were installed to prevent forced conversions through allurement.

title: 2 Children Among 6 Killed In Russian Strike On Ukraine Energy Grid
content: Russia fired a wave of drones and missiles at Ukraine overnight, killing at least six people, including two children, and cutting power to tens of thousands, officials said Sunday.

title: MK Stalin's Party And Allies Plan Move Against SIR In Supreme Court
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin chaired an all-party meeting in Chennai where a resolution was passed urging the Election Commission to immediately stop what they called the "anti-democratic" Special Intensive Revision (SIR) process.

title: 'Not A Terror Incident': 2 British Nationals Arrested For UK Train Stabbing
content: Ten people were injured following a mass stabbing on a London-bound train on Saturday evening, with the police arresting two suspects. Of the injured, nine have "life-threatening injuries."

title: 'Explosions In Pak Kept Congress Royal Family Awake': PM's Scathing Attack
content: The country was proud of its forces after the success of Operation Sindoor, but the Congress and its ally Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) did not like it, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said at a rally in Bihar's Arrah today ahead of the upcoming polls

title: "India Needs To Grow Thicker Skin": Shashi Tharoor After Scholar Deported
content: Orsini, a professor emerita at the School of Oriental and African Studies at the University of London, was deported from Delhi airport on October 21 for allegedly violating visa conditions

title: Amit Shah's "Kidnapping Portfolio" Jibe, Tejashwi Yadav's "Advani" Reminder
content: The political temperature in Bihar has heightened, with top leaders trading sharp barbs ahead of the two-phase election that begins later this week.

title: Elon Musk's "Suicide" Comment Amid Talk Of Alien Comet With Joe Rogan
content: Elon Musk said he was "never committing suicide" while discussing the mysterious interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS with podcaster Joe Rogan.

title: 'My Land, My Temple, Why Should I Inform Cops?' Andhra Priest On Stampede
content: Hari Mukunda Panda, at whose temple in Andhra Pradesh a stampede killed nine devotees yesterday, said he had not informed the local administration about the Ekadashi event.

title: 'Held Cong at gunpoint': PM Modi on how Tejashwi became oppn's Bihar CM face; takes shot at MGB
content: Prime Minister Modi intensified his criticism of the INDIA bloc in Bihar, alleging the RJD forced the Congress to name Tejashwi Yadav as CM candidate, comparing it to a gun to the head. He contrasted the NDA's unity and development focus with the opposition's alleged "jungle raj" and corruption, promising farmer support.

title: Another big win for Isro's 'Bahubali': India places its heaviest satellite in orbit
content: ISRO successfully launched CMS-03, its heaviest communication satellite, using the LVM3-M5 rocket from Sriharikota. The mission marked the fifth operational flight for the LVM3 vehicle, placing the 4410-kg satellite into a Geo-synchronous Transfer Orbit. This multi-band satellite will provide crucial communication services over oceanic regions and the Indian landmass for both civil and strategic purposes.

title: 3rd T20I: Arshdeep, Sundar star; India beat Australia to square series 1-1
content: India leveled the T20I series against Australia with a five-wicket victory in Hobart, successfully chasing 187. Washington Sundar's unbeaten 49 off 23 balls was pivotal, while Arshdeep Singh's early wickets earned him Player of the Match. Tim David's 74 had earlier propelled Australia to 186.

title: McSwadeshi? McDonald's serves millet bun burger; Centre calls it 'vindication'
content: McDonald's has launched a millet bun burger in India, a move hailed by the government as a "vindication" of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's "Millet movement." The burger utilizes indigenous technology developed by a Mysore-based institute, showcasing Indian innovation in traditional nutrition and global food trends.

title: AI caution: ‚ÄòGodfather of AI‚Äô Hinton on job wipeout fears; says AI isn‚Äôt the issue, deployment is
content: AI pioneer Geoffrey Hinton warns that artificial intelligence could eliminate millions of jobs, but the real danger stems from societal choices, not the technology itself. He argues that current economic structures prioritize short-term profits over human well-being, leading to AI being used to cut labor costs rather than enhance human potential or reduce inequality.

title: 'Op Sindoor gave Pak, Cong sleepless nights': PM Modi's scathing attack in Bihar; targets Gandhis
content: Prime Minister Modi highlighted India's retaliatory Operation Sindoor in Bihar, stating it caused sleepless nights for the Congress' "first family." He also asserted that Congress reluctantly accepted Tejashwi Yadav as the Mahagathbandhan's CM face under RJD pressure, predicting a historic defeat for "jungle raj" proponents and a sweeping NDA victory.

title: Highest-ever! Mandhana shatters WC record; falls whisker short of another milestone
content: Smriti Mandhana has become India Women's highest run-getter in a single ODI World Cup edition, surpassing Mithali Raj's 2017 record. Her consistent performance throughout the tournament, including a strong opening partnership in the final, highlighted her batting prowess. Mandhana narrowly missed reaching 1,000 World Cup runs, a feat achieved by only two other Indian batters.

title: Bihar polls: 20 yrs on, violence returns to Mokama as baahubalis clash for supremacy
content: A political murder in Bihar's Mokama has reignited fears of election violence after a local strongman, Dularchand Yadav, was killed during a poll campaign clash. His family blames JDU candidate Anant Singh, while Singh points fingers at rival Surajbhan Singh, whose wife is also contesting. The incident highlights deep-rooted caste rivalries and political complexities in the constituency.

title: Corporate duty call: Seattle Mayor tells Amazon, Microsoft to reinvest; says they have obligation
content: Mayor Bruce Harrell urged Seattle's tech giants like Microsoft and Amazon to reinvest in the community, citing their substantial profits and a "moral obligation." This call highlights the city's challenge of balancing tech's economic benefits with its impacts on housing and transportation, as Harrell seeks re-election against a progressive challenger.

title: 2025 layoffs aren‚Äôt routine: AI rewires workflows; reskilling misses the point
content: The 2025 layoff wave reflects structural shifts, not mere cost-cutting. Companies, particularly in tech, are redirecting capital from headcount to AI infrastructure, automating tasks, and redesigning workflows. Pandemic-era hiring created surplus roles now being flattened. Reskilling alone won‚Äôt protect employees; differentiation comes from proving measurable impact. Students and professionals must focus on solving real problems, building domain-specific skill stacks, and demonstrating tangible improvements, as employers prioritise judgment and workflow integration over certificates or interchangeable skills.

title: 'Got a panic attack': Rahul mocks PM at Bihar rally; claims Modi 'scared of Trump'
content: Rahul Gandhi accused Prime Minister Modi of being fearful of Donald Trump and controlled by industrialists Ambani and Adani. He claimed Modi panicked during a conflict with Pakistan due to Trump's intervention. Gandhi also criticized government policies like demonetization and GST for harming small businesses and pledged the INDIA bloc would prioritize Bihar's development and education.

title: Pankaj Tripathi‚Äôs mother passes away at 89; actor was by her side; urges privacy
content: The actor's mother, who was unwell for some time, left for her heavenly abode at the family's hometown in Belsand, Gopalganj, in Bihar on Friday, October 31.

title: Alien object: Musk & Rogan discuss 3I/ATLAS heading toward Earth
content: Unauthorized SpaceX Starshield transmissions coincide with intense scrutiny of Comet 3I/ATLAS, an interstellar object exhibiting unusual nickel composition and trajectory. Discussions on The Joe Rogan Experience podcast with Elon Musk touched upon potential alien probes and the Tunguska Event, fueling speculation about extraterrestrial origins.

title: Stefon Diggs‚Äô alleged K‚Äôyanna Barber affair escalates as Cardi B expects baby
content: Rapper Cardi B is reportedly expecting twins with NFL player Stefon Diggs, but the couple faces controversy. Diggs is also accused of fathering twins with another woman, K‚Äôyanna Barber, a situation neither party has publicly addressed. This alleged infidelity has caused fan uproar as Cardi B continues to share her pregnancy publicly.

title: PAK vs SA - 'In the next four or five years‚Ä¶': Salman Agha drops bombshell on Babar Azam
content: Babar Azam's crucial half-century guided Pakistan to a series-clinching four-wicket victory over South Africa in the T20I decider. His composed 68 off 47 balls, supported by captain Salman Ali Agha's 33, helped Pakistan successfully chase 140. Pakistan's bowlers also played a key role, keeping South Africa under par.

title: Women's World Cup final: What changes did Harmanpreet Kaur make to India's Playing XI?
content: South Africa won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the ICC Women's ODI World Cup final. Heavy rain delayed the start, but no overs were lost. Both captains expressed confidence in their teams' abilities to perform under the overcast conditions and on a pitch expected to settle.

title: Another Indian woman caught shoplifting in US; cries 'sorry' - video goes viral
content: A viral video shows an Indian woman crying and pleading with US officers, claiming she "forgot to pay" for items. The incident, which the TOI could not independently verify, echoes a previous case where an Indian tourist was arrested for shoplifting nearly $1,000 worth of goods. US authorities warn that such offenses can lead to visa revocation and future ineligibility.

title: Sneako calls out Erika Kirk over viral JD Vance hug and Charlie Kirk remark
content: A viral video shows Erika Kirk, widow of Charlie Kirk, hugging Vice President JD Vance at a Turning Point USA event. Kirk's speech comparing Vance to her late husband sparked debate, with a subsequent hug drawing widespread online commentary. Streamer Sneako's mocking remarks added to the controversy, making the incident a major political talking point.

title: Catch of the day! Rahul takes a plunge, goes fishing in Begusarai pond - watch
content: Rahul Gandhi participated in a traditional fish-catching event in Begusarai as part of his Bihar election campaign. He also criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi, accusing him of diverting youth's attention from unemployment and being controlled by Ambani and Adani.

title: Rotting roots of learning: Empty classrooms of Uttar Pradesh; a promise betrayed
content: Teacher absenteeism in Uttar Pradesh has emerged as a grave threat to the state‚Äôs education system, leaving rural classrooms deserted and students deprived of learning. The Allahabad High Court has strongly criticised the government for failing to implement an effective attendance mechanism, urging a ‚Äúsolid and practical‚Äù policy to ensure teachers‚Äô presence and uphold poor children‚Äôs right to education.

title: ‚ÄòPeople hid in toilets‚Äô: Passengers on UK train thought stabbing was Halloween prank
content: A terrifying knife attack on a Saturday evening train from Doncaster to London near Huntingdon left ten people injured, nine critically.  The incident, declared a major incident, has prompted a counter-terror investigation. Passengers described scenes of panic as armed officers boarded the train, arresting two suspects.  Authorities are working to establish the motive behind the horrific event.

title: Watch: Delhi man opens door, indoor AQI jumps from 97 to 500 in seconds- viral video
content: Delhi's air quality has plunged to dangerous levels, with a viral post highlighting how opening a door instantly pushed indoor air quality from a 'poor' 100 AQI to a 'severe' 500, despite four purifiers running.  The city's overall AQI reached 386, with many areas reporting 'severe' pollution due to stagnant winds, making life unbearable for residents.

title: Amid Asia Cup trophy controversy, Mohsin Naqvi's hug for emotional Babar Azam goes viral
content: Mohsin Naqvi, at the center of the Asia Cup controversy, was again in the spotlight congratulating Pakistan's T20I series win over South Africa. He met players, sharing a warm embrace with captain Babar Azam. This follows Pakistan's 2-1 series victory, with standout performances from Shaheen Afridi and Babar Azam leading the charge.

title: 2-year-old girl dragged away by wolf in Bahraich; massive search operation underway
content: A two-year-old girl was reportedly snatched by a wolf from her home's verandah in Kandouli village early Sunday morning.  The child was asleep while her parents worked nearby.  A frantic search is underway by police and forest officials, including drone deployment, as villagers express fear and demand action against the growing wolf threat.

title: Ind vs SA: What happens if rain washes out Women's World Cup final - Explained
content: Rain threatens to disrupt the ICC Women's World Cup final between India and South Africa in Navi Mumbai. The toss has been delayed, with a 25-50% chance of rain throughout the day. If play is interrupted, the match will resume on the reserve day, Monday, November 3, with provisions for reduced overs to ensure a fair result.

title: Will Josh Allen play tonight? Latest injury update on Bills QB vs Chiefs
content: Josh Allen is set to play tonight against the Kansas City Chiefs. This game is significant for AFC playoff seeding. Allen is expected to perform at his best, matching Patrick Mahomes drive for drive. Buffalo's defense faces challenges, placing more pressure on Allen to lead the team. His performance is critical for a Bills victory in this high-stakes matchup.

title: Born after 2007? You‚Äôll never be allowed to smoke in the Maldives
content: The Maldives has implemented a generational smoking ban for individuals born after January 2007, making it the sole nation with such a prohibition. This law, effective November 1, prohibits the purchase, use, or sale of tobacco products to this age group, including tourists. The country also maintains a complete ban on e-cigarettes and vaping products for all ages.

title: ‚ÄòKids are coughing, missing school‚Äô: Moms demand action as Delhi‚Äôs toxic air worsens
content: Warrior Moms, a network of mothers advocating for clean air, has demanded an immediate public health advisory from the Union health ministry within 48 hours. The group seeks clear guidance on AQI and PM2.5 thresholds for children's safety, appropriate masks, and urgent paediatric care signs. They also urge enhanced pollution-related health screening by paediatricians and hospitals.

title: Controversy! Rinku Singh celebrates wicket; review shows 'not out'
content: A catch controversy involving substitute fielder Rinku Singh marked a dramatic moment in Australia's innings during the third T20I against India. Arshdeep Singh nearly secured a wicket on the first ball of the 18th over, but a review helped the batter escape. Australia concluded their innings at 186 for 6.

title: Mother kills her infant in Bhind; attacks husband over suspected infidelity
content: A 20-year-old woman allegedly strangled her 28-day-old son to death in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind district after a domestic dispute. She also attacked her husband when he attempted to intervene. Police have arrested the woman and are investigating the incident, which appears to stem from marital discord and suspicion.

title: Egypt opens $1.2B Grand Museum, showcasing Tutankhamun‚Äôs tomb in full for the first time
content: Egypt has opened the Grand Egyptian Museum, a massive new archaeological museum.  It showcases over 100,000 artefacts spanning 7,000 years of history.  The museum's biggest attraction is the full display of Tutankhamun's treasures, reunited for the first time.  This grand opening aims to boost Egypt's tourism and cultural heritage.

title: Shane Bieber‚Äôs wife reacts to Alejandro Kirk‚Äôs wife‚Äôs viral World Series post
content: Blue Jays catcher Alejandro Kirk's stellar World Series performance is matched by the heartwarming social media buzz surrounding his wife, Sofia Castaneda. A simple emoji comment from Shane Bieber's wife, Kara, on Sofia's post celebrating Kirk's success ignited a viral moment, highlighting the strong camaraderie among the team's families and captivating fans.

title: 'Fight over light switch': Bengaluru techie kills manager with dumbbell in office
content: A workplace dispute over switching off lights tragically escalated into murder in Bengaluru. A 41-year-old manager was bludgeoned to death with a dumbbell by a colleague after a heated argument. The accused, a 24-year-old technical executive, surrendered to the police. Investigations into the shocking incident are ongoing.

title: 9,000 mysterious objects spotted off US shores; experts baffled
content: Tens of thousands of mysterious underwater objects, dubbed Unidentified Submersible Objects (USOs), have been logged near US coastlines by a UFO-tracking platform. These objects exhibit extreme speeds and uncanny maneuverability, even transitioning between water and air. Experts are divided, with some suggesting advanced technology or phenomena beyond current understanding, while others point to potential government deception regarding maritime security threats.

title: ‚ÄòAct of God‚Äô: Builder of Andhra temple where 9 died in stampede says nobody is responsible
content: A stampede at a privately run temple in Srikakulam district, Andhra Pradesh, killed nine devotees and injured over 25 when a railing collapsed on a narrow staircase. Panic ensued in a crowd of over 20,000 gathered for Karthika Ekadashi, with poor crowd control and lack of official clearance contributing to the tragedy. Authorities are investigating the incident.

title: Indians prefer Georgia over Ukraine for MBBS studies, RBI reports remittance increase
content: Indian students are increasingly choosing Georgia for MBBS studies, moving away from Ukraine due to the ongoing war. RBI data under the Liberalised Remittance Scheme (LRS) shows $50.25 million sent to Georgia in 2024-25, nearly five times the $10.33 million in 2018-19. Ukraine‚Äôs remittances fell sharply to $2.40 million. Russia remains an alternative with $69.94 million sent. Georgia‚Äôs low fees, English instruction, secure environment, and proximity to Europe have made it a rising destination for Indian medical students.

title: Toxicity: 15% of deaths in Delhi linked to air pollution
content: Shocking data reveals air pollution claimed one in seven lives in Delhi during 2023. Ambient particulate matter was the primary culprit, responsible for approximately 15% of all fatalities, totaling around 17,200 deaths. This pollution also led to a staggering loss of nearly 4.9 lakh years of healthy life for the city's residents.

title: Polluted cities ranking shows Delhi out of top 10 as smog covers north India
content: India faces a severe air pollution crisis. On October 30, 2025, forty of the world's most polluted cities were in India. Smaller northern cities like Sri Ganganagar and Siwani recorded extreme pollution levels. Delhi, though not in the top ten, still experienced dangerous air quality. This indicates a widespread problem across northern India.

title: Ambulance jumps red signal, crashes into vehicles in Bengaluru; 2 dead
content: A speeding ambulance lost control near Richmond Circle in Bengaluru on Saturday night, colliding with motorcycles at a red light. The tragic accident resulted in the deaths of a couple and serious injuries to two others. The ambulance driver has been detained for questioning.

title: Enrique Iglesias‚Äô concert in Mumbai: 73 phones worth Rs 23.85 lakhs stolen
content: Enrique Iglesias lit up the stage in Mumbai, captivating over 25,000 fans with an electrifying 90-minute performance. However, the night took a dramatic turn as a brazen theft left attendees reeling‚Äî73 mobile phones, worth Rs 23.85 lakh, vanished amidst the excitement. Professionals, students, and fans alike fell victim to this unfortunate incident, casting a shadow on the celebration.

title: Tottenham were devoid of ideas vs. Chelsea, and fans are turning on Thomas Frank
content: Janusz Michallik sings the praises of Mois√©s Caicedo after his starring performance in Chelsea's win over Tottenham . the 1-0 defeat to Chelsea was greeted with a chorus of boos at both the halftime and fulltime whistles . his own players, Micky van de Ven and Djed Spence, appeared to ignore his request to stay on the pitch .

title: NYC Marathon pacers guide thousands of runners to glory
content: on the FIRST Sunday of November, more than 50,000 people will lace up for the TCS New York City Marathon . pacers are the loudest unsung heroes of the marathon . watch live coverage from 8:00 to 11:30 a.m. ET on ESPN2 .

title: Halloween face paint, confused time travelers: Week 10's CFB superlatives
content: the best of the wackiest from Week 10 of the 2025 season . a number of nontraditional superlatives will show some love to some of the sport's more offbeat stories . game day eye black is a classic tradition in football, but generally simple in execution .

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: a blackout of ESPN and other Disney-owned channels, such as ABC, has been reported . the conflict affects ABC, the ESPN netwo and the foxes . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services .

title: Every MLB team's odds to win the 2026 World Series: Dodgers open as favorites
content: The confetti has fallen on the 2025 MLB season, as the  Los Angeles Dodgers  completed a Game 7 comeback for the ages and claimed their second straight World Series championship, this time over the American League champion  Toronto Blue Jays . The star-studded Dodgers -- featuring  Shohei Ohtani  and  Mookie Betts  -- will return as the favorites to win the 2026 World Series, followed by the  New York Yankees ,  Houston Astros  and  Philadelphia Phillies . The Blue Jays open at 20-1, tied with the  Chicago Cubs  for 11th. The  Seattle Mariners , the AL runners-up, open at 14-1, while the  Milwaukee Brewers , who had the league's best record in 2025, open at 18-1. At the other end of the spectrum, the  Chicago White Sox  and  Colorado Rockies  open at 500-1. Odds as of publish time. For more, visit  ESPN BET Sportsbook.   By ESPN BET

title: Week 10 truths: Miami is a mess, Ohio State looks like a sure thing
content: at points in history, the wisest among us believed, with some degree of certainty, that the earth was flat, that sea dragons consumed ships filled with gold, that Texas was back . in time, most of us who aren't Kyrie Irving have come to understand the folly of such ideas . they simply lacked information, but as we learn more, we refine our notions of how the world works .

title: CFP top 12: One last projection before the first committee ranking
content: defending national champion Ohio State should start the first college football playoff rankings on Tuesday . there could be some debate over the top spot when the 12 members of this year's group vote on teams for their first official top 25 ranking of the season . the bigger discussion will likely revolve around one-loss Alabama and undefeated Texas A&M for the no. 3 and no. 4 spots .

title: Wolves sack Pereira after winless start to season
content: Wolves  have sacked manager Vitor Pereira after a winless start to the season. The Portuguese signed a three-year contract at Molineux only in September but has been let go with the club bottom of the table after 10 games. Pereira joined Wolves in December last year and successfully helped the club stave off relegation and finish 16th. But he has struggled to create impact this season, with the defeat to Fulham on Saturday their eigth loss of the season. "Upon his arrival at Molineux last December, Pereira and his coaches made an immediate impact, guiding the team to a successful second half of the Premier League campaign," Wolves said in a statement. "However, results and performances this term have fallen below acceptable standards, and as a result a change in leadership was deemed necessary. "All eight of Pereira's backroom staff have also left the club."
